name: The Descendant
description: In THE DESCENDANT, the end of the world is only the start. With what remains of humanity protected in underground Ark facilities, your mission is to keep survivors alive, while discovering a far greater conspiracy buried within Ark-01.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows Vista+ Processor: Intel i3 2.0GHz or equivalent Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: AMD or nVidia card with 1GB RAM DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 12 GB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Intel i5 2.5GHz or equivalent Memory: 6 GB RAM Graphics: nVidia 500 series or higher DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 12 GB available space

reviews.review_text: So far I really enjoyed the 1st episode. It might have been a bit short but thrilling nonetheless. You're left quite puzzled as to what happened at Ark 01 and right now I can't wait to play the next episode to get some of my questions answered. If you enjoyed the story driven telltale games then this one is worth picking up.

8.5/10 - If Tell Tale Was an Indie Point and Click You’d Have This!  When I started playing this game, I got excited pretty quick. As literally every review says this game is a sexy mashup of fallout, telltale and point and click elements. The graphics and atmosphere are just awesome and the price is right at $3/episode! Although it’s point and click you have to react quickly and make choices that will impact your story progression. (Telltale Shout out)   Sometime in the future the world went to ♥♥♥♥; unlivable for the human race. In a last ditch effort for survival, humanity sealed themselves in Arks… aka underground bunkers or Vaults. (Fallout Shout out.) As time passed Mother Nature began to rectify the damaged world and soon after the vaults opened up… all except Ark 01. Why didn’t this ark function like the rest?   Overall, I’m extremely excited for this game. It comes in 5 episodes which are supposed to all be released throughout 2016. I don’t think they will make this goal since the 2nd episode just recently came out… meaning 3 more episodes in just 5 months. Regardless; definitely worth the money!     Accidently Reviewed

A seemingly good near future apocalypse story told from two different temporal perspectives many years apart. Nicely drawn and the puzzles are not too difficult. Short at an hour and a bit but then the price range is fine for that. Looking forward to Episode 2 as the mystery unfolds further. Till then...4 more achievements to earn.
The first episode was maybe a little too short but I'm looking forward to the next episode. Good graphics!

Poor man's TellTale game.  I try to be as short as I can. + TellTale game feeling, although there's no chance you can be confused if it's a TT title or not. It's a cheap replica + interesting story + great voice acting - pace is too slow (kind of boring sometimes) - object selecting interface is uncomfortable - puzzles are too simple  It's worth a couple of bucks, without a doubt.

I like telltales the walking dead, and I really enjoyed this first episode of the Descendants aswell. It´s an interesting story and the graphic style is nice. Unfortunately it´s very short and the puzzles aren´t that challenging, but on the other hand it costs only 3 bucks and the developers will probably listen to the cons and improve them to the next episodes. I am looking forward to the next one!

A great story driven point and click game that's similar to Telltale's formulaic adventure games. It's got good voice acting and fleshed out characters. The background world is interesting and gives the game's own plot a very good mystery to think about.  Just like Telltale's games, it's not very challenging and the controls can be improved. I experienced minor gameplay bugs, but they have all been fixed long before this review.  This game is very much worth it for it's price.
Its like an interactive TV series where you want to know more! Its great entertainment value for what you pay!
Feels like you are in a TV show, but you are the one making the decisions.

The voice actors were changed after episode 3 launched. Major downgrade. Much preferred the originals.  Game controls are a bit clunky. It seems to have gotten a bit better since episode 4 released.  Story line is interesting enough that I recommend it if you're a big scifi type of person. Otherwise I don't recommend.  I give it a yes because it's not terrible enough to say no.

It's part one of five. I think the stage could have been set better. When I compare this to what was done in the first episodes of the 'walking dead' and 'the wolf among us', this is lacking. In those I was hooked and couldn't wait to continue the story. In this, I'm not attached to anyone and don't care. It was more about getting through it than the experience. That's not to say the next episode can't turn it around. But right now, sadly I can't recommend the game. From what I experienced so far in episode ONE, it didn't grab me. It was just OK.

point and click controls? seriously?  and the first time ive ever had to continuosly mash an activation button to keep a crank turning, then sequence stops, and starts 2 more times on a door YOU HAVE TO GO THROUGH...   so yeah... lost everyone in the first go through due to laggy unresposive activation tiles, and laggy unresponcive controlls.. espiciialy when you get near the steam. got game over just trying to fix a water heater due to activation tiles either slow to come up, or not displaying at all.  so first impresion? not good.  barely have enough time to do the first obstical without all the time eaters..  aside from the crappy, buggy controll system, i would say the first 10 min of the game before i turned it off were kind of enjoyable... maby.. i like the puzzel aspect.. that and the almost fixed cameras kind of reminded me of old school resident evil..

Not much of a 'game' to play. If you liked DrwamFall: The Longest Journey, you'll like this. I hated Dreamfall. There were no choices, nothing to figure out. Just click on the only things you can to progress.  I do love story based games, if there are still gameplay mechanics. If it is just clicking through a visual novel, I'm not that interested. With that said, I'm still interested in what the Decendants story turns out to be, and I'll play through all the chapters. But so far, the gameplay isn't engaging.  Pros: Good story and voice acting.  Cons: Camera is garbage.  Convert the camera into an over the shoulder 3rd person view, and this will come off much better.  Add more in-game responses (by the characters) to the state of the Ark as it is found.  You have a giant facility that is in a state of disarry. You could have added a bunch of interesting things to do, and ways to get around. You focused only on the 'Story' instead of on gameplay.
